ygData.subject: Re: My Thoughts on Monks
ygData.msgSnippet: I am not saying not to do them at all. but I am saying that I dont think you should pursue them directly do them as you obtain the item thru regular questing
ygData.messageBody:
I am not saying not to do them at all. but I am saying that I dont think you
should pursue them directly do them as you obtain the item thru regular
questing and adventureing. Some people veiw the challenge of obtaining the
better equipment on their own without buying it a quest in itself. I have
done the quests as I get the items and I have the black wand and saphirre in
the bank right now. but i dont go out of my way to get them.
----- Original Message -----
From: Dizzy J. <dizzyj@...>
To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, August 19, 1999 5:04 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] My Thoughts on Monks


> From: "Dizzy J." <dizzyj@...>
>
> the only real reason why I'm planning on continuing my sash, headband
> quests, is that there really isnt anything to gain from the game unless
> you do quests. sure I can get better equipment, and I probably will wear
> better equipment, but for what purpose? I get better stuff, so that I can
> manage in dungeons, so that I can get better stuff, so that....etc..etc.
>
> for me, questing is part of exploring, and thats what I get out of the
> game.
>
> On Thu, 19 Aug 1999, Tim Perkins wrote:
>
> > From: "Tim Perkins" <tperkins@...>
> >
> > hehe Long way to travel from freeport just for a bracer. Thats the only
> > reason I didnt mention it, but you are correct. My advice is not to
pursue
> > the sash and headband quests specifically as they are just not worth it.
> > (IMO) There are plenty of things you can wear that are better. In your
> > normal course of advancement you will be able to obtain the items you
need.
> > Witht he possibility of the quest not working when you hand over the
items
> > to the guild it makes it just that much worse.
> >
> > Kizmet Bayashi
> > Monk of the 32nd
> > E. Marr
> >
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Giro, Michael (OTS-EDH) <Michael_Giro@...>
> > To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
> > Sent: Thursday, August 19, 1999 2:36 PM
> > Subject: RE: [EQ-Monks] My Thoughts on Monks
> >
> >
> > > From: "Giro, Michael (OTS-EDH)" <Michael_Giro@...>
> > >
> > > or the ever popular Crushbone where Legionnaire's and bracers are dime
a
> > > dozen, might even be able to buy one really cheap.
> > >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Tim Perkins [mailto:tperkins@...]
> > > Sent: Thursday, August 19, 1999 10:50 AM
> > > To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
> > > Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] My Thoughts on Monks
> > >
> > >
> > > From: "Tim Perkins" <tperkins@...>
> > >
> > > you get the bracer from an orc with the same name. look in east
Commands
> > or
> > > MistyThicket
> > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > From: Worlord <worlord99@...>
> > > To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
> > > Sent: Thursday, August 19, 1999 12:56 PM
> > > Subject: [EQ-Monks] My Thoughts on Monks
> > >
> > >
> > > > From: Worlord <worlord99@...>
> > > >
> > > > First off I am fairly new to EQ... tomorrow I will
> > > > have been playing for a week in real life time. I
> > > > spent a lot of time looking into the game before I
> > > > bought and decided I would have the most fun playing a
> > > > monk. I started a Monk character and have been
> > > > immensily satisfied, I am level 8. (I started in
> > > > freeport)
> > > >
> > > > Onto sashes. I have had horrible experiences with
> > > > sashes. I got the white sash at Level 2, you would
> > > > have a hell of a time killing deathfist pawns at level
> > > > 1 so I think most ppl get it at 2. Anyway... by 5 I
> > > > was out of the newbie area and began searching for the
> > > > things needed for the yellow headband, to refresh our
> > > > memory you need a Tarantula Chitin, a Deathfist
> > > > Slashed Belt, and a Giant Snake Rattle. I worked hard
> > > > to get these items, and because I was trying at a
> > > > lower level than I should it was very difficult. I
> > > > managed to kill a tarantula with a group of 4 people.
> > > > I also found the rattle and slashed belt this way.
> > > > Great I thought, I as level 6 and I was about to get
> > > > something that most ppl can't get on their own till 7
> > > > or 8. I took the stuff back, turned it all in and I
> > > > got nothing. I was so pissed. I had to go back to
> > > > newbie area to find all the stuff I needed for white,
> > > > then I went back and I was so pissed that I bought the
> > > > giant snake rattle and chitin and managed to find
> > > > someone to give me the slashed belt. This time I
> > > > turned it in and it worked.
> > > >
> > > > I'm not looking forward to Orange tho. I need a
> > > > Greater Lightstone, Legionaire's bracers, and a
> > > > Cutthroat insignia ring. I have the latter and I can
> > > > buy the former if I have to but I don't have a clue
> > > > what the legionare's bracers are... its probably not
> > > > worth the effort
> > > >
> > > > Worlord
> > > > worlord99@...
> > > >
